title: tyzen
author: tyzen
content: Hello there, i have been spending few days just to get open source mobile wallet on github, but still can find it..Is there any idea ?What i am looking for is, that the system are using RPC api, without electreum..thank you

comments.author: BitMaxz
comments.body: Only two Android BTC wallets that I know but I'm not sure if they are using RPC API you can check this one below- https://github.com/bitpay/walletIt is Copay before since there are many fake copay wallets they remove the original open-source copay and push to this link for the open-source Bitpay wallet. Another wallet is breadwallet check the link below- https://github.com/breadwallet/breadwallet-android

comments.author: OmegaStarScream
comments.created_time: July 30, 2022, 12:40:17 PMLast edit: July 30, 2022, 12:54:22 PM by OmegaStarScream
comments.body: Quote from: ETFbitcoin on July 30, 2022, 11:31:45 AMCould you elaborate? Are you looking wallet which also offer RPC/API or wallet which use existing RPC/API (but not Electrum protocol)?I think he wants something that connects to the bitcoin core node directly/custom backend and doesn't use the Electrum server.@OP I'm not sure if these wallets use what you're asking but here you go:Trustwallet (part of it): https://github.com/trustwallet/wallet-coreMycelium: https://github.com/mycelium-comTrezor suite: https://github.com/trezor/trezor-suite

comments.author: Husires
comments.body: Can we know exactly what you're trying to do? If I understood you correctly, I think Mycelium is the best choice and you can use Unstoppable - Bitcoin & Crypto WalletBut if you want something that deals with RPC/APIs better, I suggest that you install BTCpayserver and then link any wallet.
